original: HANSEN, Fred Herman Roeck, Kapten, Civilingenjör, Stockholm, f Sthlm 2/12 97 av gen.dir F V H o Tyra Benckert, gm Brita Lindquist. Studex Sthlm 15, KTH (VoV) 15—20. Resoffex o fänr i Fortif :s res 17, ulöjtn 20 o löjtn 22, löjtn VVK 24, kapt VVK 31. Major v Finska armén 40. Anst h major A Lundström Sundsvall v kraftstnsundersökn, vägstakn samt väg- o brokontr 20—22, handhade undersökn f rengärde i sv-norska gränstrakterna 22, bitr ing i Väg- o vattenbyggn.-styr 22, anst v Whangpoo Concervancy Board Shanghai 23—25, bitr ing v AB Vattenbyggn.byrån 26, v Hammarforsens kraftvksbyggn 26, arb.chef h Dalälvens Regl.frn f Vänjasjöns regl mm 26—29, kontr f kraftvksanläggn v Avesta Storfors 29—30, arb.ch v Tekn Byggn.-byrån Delin & Perslow f Höljebro kraftvksbyggn 30—32, ch.ass v dna byggn.byrå Sthlm 32—37, arb.chef v Södersjukhusbygget 38-^3, chef f sv arb.kåren Finl 40, inneh F Hansens konsult Ing.byrå fr 44. Led av Försvarets avtalsnämnd., Led Sv Tekn.frn. Av trycket: Organisation av en större arb.plats inom vat-tenbyggn.facket (Sv Vattenkraftfrns publ 34) samt upps i organisatoriska frågor i fackpressen. Resor: Kina 23—25. FFrK m sv. Hobbies: Friluftsliv, långfärder på skridskor, ridning.
translated: HANSEN, Fred Herman Roeck, Captain, Civil Engineer, Stockholm, b. Sthlm 2/12 97 to Director-General F V H and Tyra Benckert, m. Brita Lindquist. Graduated from Sthlm 1915, KTH (Royal Institute of Technology) 1915-1920. Reserve Officer Candidate and Second Lieutenant in the Fortress Artillery: reserve 1917, sublieutenant 1920, lieutenant 1922, lieutenant in the National Voluntary Reserve Cadet Corps (Nordbat) 1924, captain 1931. Major in the Finnish Army 1940. Employed as a major in A Lundström Sundsvall for power plant investigations, road measurements, and road and bridge contracts 1920-1922, conducted investigations on the cleaning of rivers in the Swedish-Norwegian border areas 1922, assistant engineer at the Road and Water Construction Authority 1922, employed by the Whangpoo Conservancy Board in Shanghai 1923-1925, assistant engineer at AB Vattenbyggnadsbyrån 1926, involved in the construction of the Hammarforsens power plant 1926, working chief officer at Dalälvens Regulating Work from Vänjasjön regulating dam, etc. 1926-1929, contract management for power plant installations at Avesta Storfors 1929-1930, chief architect at the Engineering Firm Delin & Perslow for the Höljebro power plant construction 1930-1932, assistant chief architect at the Construction Agency DNA in Stockholm 1932-1937, chief engineer at the Södersjukhuset Hospital construction project 1938-1943, chief of the Swedish Labor Corps in Finland 1940, owner of F Hansen's Consulting Engineering Firm since 1944. Member of the Defense Labor Board, member of the Swedish Technical Association. Published works include: Organization of a larger construction site within the water engineering sector (publication of the Swedish Hydropower Association 1934), and essays on organizational matters in trade press. Travelled to China 1923-1925. Member of the Swedish Skating Association. Hobbies: Outdoor activities, long-distance skating, horseback riding.

publication.name: Organization of a larger construction site within the water engineering sector
